ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1 hour per week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: It was very helpful!
Strengths: - went over basic professional communication tools that many students definitely needed to learn. Weaknesses: - hard to engage all students (especially b/c it was at 6-8pm)
Strengths: - went over basic concepts of professional communication everyone should learn - many opportunities for feedback Weaknesses: - bad timing (6-8 pm on a Thursday night?!)
it helps me a lot
good practice for interviews
Great seminar
This course is useful and covers many interesting topics in career development. The coaches are all approachable and gives all of us detailed feedback.
the most useful professional skills class I have ever taken

This course provides excellent, one-on-one professional skills training. The hands-on sessions were the most valuable; the lectures towards the beginning of the course could be omitted or modified to include more hands-on exercises.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: William Albert Vance  Great

Instructor: William Albert Vance  William was only helpful if you wanted him to be. As in, if students were checked out, they probably complained about this course a lot; whereas, if students were actually interested in learning professional communication skills, he was great.

Instructor: William Albert Vance  William was really helpful, but only if you wanted him to be. What I mean by that is that some students really complained about this seminar, but I really do think everyone should have taken in more seriously especially with the help of William.
Instructor: William Albert Vance  great
Instructor: William Albert Vance  good
Instructor: William Albert Vance  Clear and passionate about the work
Instructor: William Albert Vance  Good
Instructor: William Albert Vance  The instructor is approachable and introduces useful skills in an easy-to-understand manner.
Instructor: William Albert Vance  good at giving constructive feedbacks
Instructor: William Albert Vance  Excellent, very knowledgeable!
Instructor: William Albert Vance  He is very kind.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Very helpful and beneficial to do before internship interviews and such. If you put the effort in youll see results!
highly underrated course. Even if it's a requirement, students need to take the materials learned in this course to heart.
Highly underrated. Definitely recommend.
good, recommend for first student
Yes
Would recommend
I would recommend it to a student with relevant interests.
teach proper writing, communicating and interview skills through lots of practise yes it is useful
A required class for MPH students that for the most part is very helpful.
